Name: Hichens, Mr. Robert
Remarks: on the ship's wheel when the ship struck the iceberg, accused of calling people in the water "stiffs", accused of constantly criticising others, accused of being drunk, Margaret Brown threatened to throw him overboard

Name: Lurette, Miss. Eugénie Elise
Profession: as Marie Spencers maid she was on the same boat. apparently boat 6

Name: Lindström, Mrs. Sigrid
Profession: was assisted by Björnström-Steffansson, Mr. Mauritz Hokan who was reported to have helped some women into Boat 6. Some accounts suggest she was in Boat 6 as well, which fits her 1st class status!

Name: Candee, Mrs. Helen Churchill
Remarks: chaperoned by Colonel Archibald Gracie, friends with Edward Austin Kent, gave Edward Austin Kent valuable items sold at auction after disaster

Name: Brown, Mrs. Margaret
Profession: suffragette, socialite, philantropist, husband in mining business
Remarks: The Unsinkable Mrs. Brown, rowed the boat with Helen Churchill Candee

Name: Rescue Time (Carpathia)
Age: one of the last to reach the Carpathia
